paper_abstract: A compact set c in R-d is kappa-round if for every point p is an element of partial derivative c there exists a closed ball that contains p, is contained in c, and has radius kappa diam c. We show that, for any fixed kappa > 0, the combinatorial complexity of the union of n kappa-round, not necessarily convex, objects in R-3 (resp., in R-4) of constant description complexity is O(n(2+epsilon)) ( resp., O(n(3+epsilon))) for any epsilon > 0, where the constant of proportionality depends on e, kappa, and the algebraic complexity of the objects. The bound is almost tight in the worst case.
paper_title: On the union of kappa-round objects in three and four dimensions
